definitions.definition: embarrassment and the loss of other people's respect, or behaviour that causes this:
examples: They were sent home in disgrace.

definitions.definition: to be a very bad situation:
examples: Three families living in one room - it's a disgrace!

definitions.definition: to be so bad or unacceptable that you make people lose respect for the group or activity you are connected to:
examples: You're a disgrace (to the family) - what a way to behave!

definitions.definition: to make people stop respecting you or your family, team, etc. by doing something very bad:
examples: You have disgraced us all with your behaviour.
